item.title: William add a quote by Raymond Chandler
item.description: "You were dead, you were sleeping the big sleep, you were not bothered by things like that, oil and water were the same as wind and air to you. You just slept the big sleep, not caring about the nastiness of how you died or where you fell. Me, I was part of the nastiness now. Far more a part of it than Rusty Regan was." -- Raymond Chandler

item.title: William add a quote by Graham Chapman
item.description: "I don't want to talk to you no more, you empty headed animal food trough wiper. I fart in your general direction. Your mother was a hamster and your father smelt of elderberries." -- Graham Chapman

item.title: William add a quote by Dashiell Hammett
item.description: "The problem with putting two and two together is that sometimes you get four, and sometimes you get twenty-two." -- Dashiell Hammett

item.title: William add a quote by Lao Tse
item.description: "To attain knowledge, add things everyday. To attain wisdom, remove things every day." -- Lao Tse

item.title: William add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The fact that we live at the bottom of a deep gravity well, on the surface of a gas covered planet going around a nuclear fireball 90 million miles away and think this to be normal is obviously some indication of how skewed our perspective tends to be." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: William add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "(When asked what he thought of Western civilization): 'I think it would be a good idea." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: William add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "The best argument against democracy is a five-minute conversation with the average voter." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: William add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "If you cannot read all your books...fondle them---peer into them, let them fall open where they will, read from the first sentence that arrests the eye, set them back on the shelves with your own hands, arrange them on your own plan so that you at least know where they are. Let them be your friends; let them, at any rate, be your acquaintances." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: William add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "It is a good thing for an uneducated man to read books of quotations." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: William add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "When his life was ruined, his family killed, his farm destroyed, Job knelt down on the ground and yelled up to the heavens, "Why god? Why me?" and the thundering voice of God answered, There's just something about you that pisses me off." -- Stephen King

item.title: William add a quote by Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: "I kept always two books in my pocket, one to read, one to write in." -- Robert Louis Stevenson

item.title: William add a quote by Monty Python
item.description: "No one expects the Spanish Inquisition! Our chief weapon is surprise, fear and surprise; two chief weapons, fear, surprise, and ruthless efficiency! Er, among our chief weapons are: fear, surprise, ruthless efficiency, and near fanatical devotion to the Pope! Um, I'll come in again..." -- Monty Python

item.title: William add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "You must keep sending work out; you must never let a manuscript do nothing but eat its head off in a drawer. You send that work out again and again, while you're working on another one. If you have talent, you will receive some measure of success - but only if you persist." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: William add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "Stop worrying about the world ending today. It's already tomorrow in Australia." -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: William add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description:
"We must take arms each and every day, perhaps knowing that the battle cannot be entirely won, but fight we must, if only a gentle bout. The smallest effort to win means, at the end of each day, a sort of victory. Remember that pianist who said that if he did not pratice every day he would know, if he did not practice for two days, the critics would know, after three days, his audiences would know.
A variation of this is true for writers. Not that your style, whatever that is, would melt out of shape in those few days.
But what would happen is that the world would catch up with and try to sicken you. If you did not write every day, the poisons would accumulate and you would begin to die, or act crazy, or both." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: William add a quote by Fritz Leiber
item.description: "The dark dangerous forest is still there, my friends. Beyond the space of the astronauts and the astronomers, beyond the dark, tangled regions of Freudian and Jungian psychiatry, beyond the dubious psi-realms of Dr. Rhine, beyond the areas policed by the commissars and priests and motivations-research men, far, far beyond the mad, beat, half-hysterical laughter... the utterly unknown still is and the eerie and ghostly lurk, as much wrapped in mystery as ever." -- Fritz Leiber

item.title: William add a quote by Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: "The difficulty of literature is not to write, but to write what you mean; not to affect your reader, but to affect him precisely as you wish." -- Robert Louis Stevenson

item.title: William add a quote by Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: "Death, like a host, comes smiling to the door; Smiling, he greets us, on that tranquil shore Where neither piping bird nor peeping dawn Disturbs the eternal sleep, But in the stillness far withdrawn Our dreamless rest for evermore we keep." -- Robert Louis Stevenson

item.title: William add a quote by Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: "To know what you prefer instead of humbly saying Amen to what the world tells you you ought to prefer, is to have kept your soul alive." -- Robert Louis Stevenson

item.title: William add a quote by Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: "To be what we are, and to become what we are capable of becoming, is the only end of life." -- Robert Louis Stevenson

item.title: William add a quote by Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: "Books are good enough in their own way but they are a mighty bloodless substitute for life." -- Robert Louis Stevenson

item.title: William add a quote by Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: "It is not so much for its beauty that the forest makes a claim upon men's hearts, as for that subtle something, that quality of air that emanation from old trees, that so wonderfully changes and renews a weary spirit." -- Robert Louis Stevenson

item.title: William add a quote by Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description:
"Under the wide and starry sky Dig the grave and let me lie: Glad did I live and gladly die, And I laid me down with a will.
This be the verse you grave for me: <i>Here he lies where he long'd to be; Home is the sailor, home from the sea, And the hunter home from the hill.</i>" -- Robert Louis Stevenson

item.title: William add a quote by Isaac Bashevis Singer
item.description: "I believe in God but people are liars. It's those people who say they are appointed by God who I don't believe in." -- Isaac Bashevis Singer

item.title: William add a quote by William Meikle
item.description: "OK cosmos, I could use some good news. Go on, surprise me." -- William Meikle

item.title: William add a quote by William Meikle
item.description: "Big beasties, swordplay, aliens, guns, ghosts, vampires, eldritch things from beyond and slime. A lot of slime." -- William Meikle

item.title: William add a quote by William Meikle
item.description: "People should learn to live in the now. They spend all their time thinking about past glories and worrying about the future. Meanwhile all the moments of spontaneity and beauty they’ll ever have in their lives are flitting from future into past without being noticed. That’s why there are so many grumpy assholes in the world" -- William Meikle

item.title: William add a quote by William Meikle
item.description: "Life is an opportunity to create meaning by our deeds, our actions and how we manage our way through the short part of infinity we're given to operate in. And once our life is finished, our atoms go back to forming other interesting configurations with those of other people, animals, plants and anything else that happens to be around, as we all roll along in one big, ever changing, universe." -- William Meikle

item.title: William add a quote by William Meikle
item.description: "The Earth spins once a day. It goes around the sun once a year. The moon goes round the earth every 28 days. Your heart beats in a rhythm particular only to you. Everything has its drumbeat and everything contributes to the dance. You’ve just got to know when to lead and when to follow." -- William Meikle

item.title: William add a quote by William Meikle
item.description: "I write to escape. I haven't managed it yet, but I'm working on it" -- William Meikle
